API Reference#

antarctic_plots.profile#

antarctic_plots.profile.create_profile(method, start=None, stop=None, num=100, shp_num_points=None, shapefile=None)[source]#

function to create a pandas DataFrame of points along a line with multiple methods

antarctic_plots.profile.fill_nans(df)[source]#

function to fill NaNâ€™s in sampled layer with values from above layer. Ignores first 3 columns as they are assumed to by x, y, dist. df: pandas DataFrame

should follow output of sample_grids

antarctic_plots.profile.make_data_dict(names, grids, colors)[source]#

function to create dictionary for attributes of platting data names, grids, and colors are list or 1-d arrays

antarctic_plots.profile.plot_profile(method, start=None, stop=None, num=100, layers_dict=None, shapefile=None, shp_num_points=None, fillnans=True, clip=False, max_dist=None, min_dist=None, add_map=True, buffer_perc=0.2, map_background='C:\\Users\\matthewt\\AppData\\Local\\pooch\\pooch\\Cache\\48e7e250f03777eeea6460a4c74cf317-tiff_90pct.zip.unzip\\tiff_90pct\\00000-20080319-092059124.tif', map_cmap='earth', data_dict=None, save=False, path=None)[source]#

Function to plot cross section of earth layers and optionally add a plot of data along the same line. Optionally can plot the line location on a map with an input grid for the background. data_dict: nested dictionary of format {â€˜nameâ€™: {â€˜nameâ€™:str},

{â€˜gridâ€™: xarray.DataArray}, {â€˜colorâ€™: str},}

antarctic_plots.profile.sample_grids(df, grid, name=None)[source]#

function to sample data at every point along a line df: pandas DataFrame

should follow output of create_profile first 3 columns in order are x, y, dist.

grid: str

grid file to be sampled.

antarctic_plots.profile.shorten(df, max_dist=None, min_dist=None)[source]#

function to shorten profile on either end and recalculate distance

antarctic_plots.fetch#

antarctic_plots.fetch.basement(plot=False, info=False)[source]#

Offshore and sub-Ross Ice Shelf basement topography. from Tankersley et al. 2022: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1029/2021GL097371 offshore data from Lindeque et al. 2016: https://doi.org/10.1002/2016GC006401

antarctic_plots.fetch.bedmap2(layer, plot=False, info=False)[source]#

bedmap2 data, from https://doi.org/10.5194/tc-7-375-2013. layer is one of following strings:

â€˜thicknessâ€™, â€˜bedâ€™, â€˜surfaceâ€™, â€˜geiod_to_WGS84â€™

antarctic_plots.fetch.deepbedmap(plot=False, info=False, region=None, spacing=10000.0)[source]#

DeepBedMap, from Leong and Horgan, 2020: https://doi.org/10.5194/tc-14-3687-2020 Accessed from https://zenodo.org/record/4054246#.Ysy344RByp0

antarctic_plots.fetch.gravity(type, plot=False, info=False, region=None, spacing=5000.0)[source]#

Preliminary compilation of Antarctica gravity and gravity gradient data. Updates on 2016 AntGG compilation. Accessed from https://ftp.space.dtu.dk/pub/RF/4D-ANTARCTICA/. type is either â€˜FAâ€™ or â€˜BAâ€™, for free-air and bouguer anomalies, respectively.

antarctic_plots.fetch.groundingline()[source]#

Antarctic groundingline shape file, from https://doi.pangaea.de/10.1594/PANGAEA.819147 Supplement to Depoorter et al. 2013: https://doi.org/10.1038/nature12567

antarctic_plots.fetch.imagery()[source]#

Antarctic imagery from LIMA: https://lima.usgs.gov/fullcontinent.php will replace with below once figured out login issue with pooch

MODIS Mosaic of Antarctica: https://doi.org/10.5067/68TBT0CGJSOJ

Assessed from https://daacdata.apps.nsidc.org/pub/DATASETS/nsidc0730_MEASURES_MOA2014_v01/geotiff/

antarctic_plots.fetch.magnetics(version, plot=False, info=False, region=None, spacing=5000.0)[source]#
version, one of following strings:

â€˜admap2â€™, â€˜admap1â€™, â€˜admap2_eq_srcâ€™, â€˜admap2_gdbâ€™

1) ADMAP2 magnetic anomaly compilation of Antarctica. Non-geosoft specific files provide from Sasha Golynsky. 2) ADMAP-2001 magnetic anomaly compilation of Antarctica. https://admap.kongju.ac.kr/databases.html 3) ADMAP2 eqivalent sources, from https://admap.kongju.ac.kr/admapdata/ 4) Geosoft-specific .gdb abridged files. Accessed from https://doi.pangaea.de/10.1594/PANGAEA.892722?format=html#download

antarctic_plots.fetch.sample_shp(name)[source]#

load 1 of 2 sample shapefiles name =is either â€˜Disco_deep_transectâ€™ or â€˜Roosevelt_Islandâ€™

antarctic_plots.utils#

antarctic_plots.utils.GMT_reg_xy_to_ll(input)[source]#

Function to convert GMT region string [e, w, n, s] in EPSG:3031 to deg:min:sec input: array of 4 strings.

antarctic_plots.utils.dd2dms(dd)[source]#

Function to convert decimal degrees to minutes, seconds. Modified from https://stackoverflow.com/a/10286690/18686384

antarctic_plots.utils.epsg3031_to_latlon(df, reg=False, input=['x', 'y'], output=['lon', 'lat'])[source]#

Function to convert coordinates from EPSG:3031 Antarctic Polar Stereographic in meters to EPSG:4326 WGS84 in decimal degrees. default input dataframe columns are â€˜xâ€™ and â€˜yâ€™ default output dataframe columns are â€˜lonâ€™ and â€˜latâ€™ default returns a dataframe with x, y, lat, and lon if reg=True, returns a region in format [e, w, n, s]

antarctic_plots.utils.get_grid_info(grid)[source]#

Function to return spacing and region from grid.grid returns tuple of spacing (int) and region (1x4 array)

antarctic_plots.utils.latlon_to_epsg3031(df, reg=False, input=['lon', 'lat'], output=['x', 'y'])[source]#

Function to convert coordinates from EPSG:4326 WGS84 in decimal degrees to EPSG:3031 Antarctic Polar Stereographic in meters. default input dataframe columns are â€˜lonâ€™ and â€˜latâ€™ default output dataframe columns are â€˜xâ€™ and â€˜yâ€™ default returns a dataframe with x, y, lat, and lon if reg=True, returns a region in format [e, w, n, s]

antarctic_plots.utils.mask_from_shp(shapefile, invert=True, xr_grid=None, grid_file=None, region=None, spacing=None, masked=False, crs='epsg:3031')[source]#

Function to create a mask or a masked grid from area inside or outside of a shapefile. shapefile: str; path to .shp filename. invert: bool; mask inside or outside of shapefile, defaults to True. xr_grid: xarray.DataArray(); to use to define region, or to mask. grid_gile: str; path to a .nc grid file to use to define region or to mask. region: str or 1x4 array; use to make mock grid if no grids are supplied. GMT region string or 1x4 array [e,w,n,s] spacing: str or float; GMT spacing string or float to use to make a mock grid if none are supplied. crs: str; if grid is provided, rasterio needs to assign a coordinate reference system via an epsg code

antarctic_plots.utils.plot_grd(grid, cmap, cbar_label, plot_region=None, cmap_region=None, coast=False, constraints=False, grd2cpt_name=False, origin_shift='initialize')[source]#

Function to automate PyGMT plotting

Parameters

  • cmap (str) â€“

  • cbar_label (str) â€“

antarctic_plots.utils.reg_str_to_df(input, names=['x', 'y'])[source]#

Function to convert GMT region string [e, w, n, s] to pandas dataframe with 4 coordinates input: array of 4 strings. names: defauts to â€˜xâ€™, â€˜yâ€™, output df column names
